sizeColumnsToFit.description: /** Gets the grid to size the columns to the specified width in pixels, e.g. `sizeColumnsToFit(900)`. To have the grid fit the columns to the grid's width, use the Grid API `gridApi.sizeColumnsToFit()` instead. */

setColumnGroupOpened.description: /** Call this if you want to open or close a column group. */

getColumnGroup.description: /** Returns the column group with the given name. */

getProvidedColumnGroup.description: /** Returns the provided column group with the given name. */

getDisplayNameForColumn.description: /** Returns the display name for a column. Useful if you are doing your own header rendering and want the grid to work out if `headerValueGetter` is used, or if you are doing your own column management GUI, to know what to show as the column name. */

getDisplayNameForColumnGroup.description: /** Returns the display name for a column group (when grouping columns). */

getColumn.description: /** Returns the column with the given `colKey`, which can either be the `colId` (a string) or the `colDef` (an object). */

getColumns.description: /** Returns all the columns, regardless of visible or not. */

applyColumnState.description: /** Applies the state of the columns from a previous state. Returns `false` if one or more columns could not be found. */

getColumnState.description: /** Gets the state of the columns. Typically used when saving column state. */

resetColumnState.description: /** Sets the state back to match the originally provided column definitions. */

getColumnGroupState.description: /** Gets the state of the column groups. Typically used when saving column group state. */

setColumnGroupState.description: /** Sets the state of the column group state from a previous state. */

resetColumnGroupState.description: /** Sets the state back to match the originally provided column definitions. */

isPinning.description: /** Returns `true` if pinning left or right, otherwise `false`. */

getDisplayedColAfter.description: /** Returns the column to the right of the provided column, taking into consideration open / closed column groups and visible columns. This is useful if you need to know what column is beside yours e.g. if implementing your own cell navigation. */

getDisplayedColBefore.description: /** Same as `getVisibleColAfter` except gives column to the left. */

setColumnVisible.description: /** Sets the visibility of a column. Key can be the column ID or `Column` object. */

setColumnsVisible.description: /** Same as `setColumnVisible`, but provide a list of column keys. */

setColumnPinned.description: /** Sets the column pinned / unpinned. Key can be the column ID, field, `ColDef` object or `Column` object. */

setColumnsPinned.description: /** Same as `setColumnPinned`, but provide a list of column keys. */

getAllGridColumns.description:
/** Returns all the grid columns, same as `getColumns()`, except
 * 
 *   a) it has the order of the columns that are presented in the grid
 * 
 *   b) it's after the 'pivot' step, so if pivoting, has the value columns for the pivot. */

getDisplayedLeftColumns.description: /** Same as `getAllDisplayedColumns` but just for the pinned left portion of the grid. */

getDisplayedCenterColumns.description: /** Same as `getAllDisplayedColumns` but just for the center portion of the grid. */

getDisplayedRightColumns.description: /** Same as `getAllDisplayedColumns` but just for the pinned right portion of the grid. */

getAllDisplayedColumns.description: /** Returns all columns currently displayed (e.g. are visible and if in a group, the group is showing the columns) for the pinned left, centre and pinned right portions of the grid. */

getAllDisplayedVirtualColumns.description: /** Same as `getAllGridColumns()`, except only returns rendered columns, i.e. columns that are not within the viewport and therefore not rendered, due to column virtualisation, are not displayed. */

moveColumn.description: /** Moves a column to `toIndex`. The column is first removed, then added at the `toIndex` location, thus index locations will change to the right of the column after the removal. */

moveColumnByIndex.description: /** Same as `moveColumn` but works on index locations. */

moveColumns.description: /** Same as `moveColumn` but works on list. */

moveRowGroupColumn.description: /** Move the column to a new position in the row grouping order. */

setColumnAggFunc.description: /** Sets the agg function for a column. `aggFunc` can be one of `'min' | 'max' | 'sum'`. */

setColumnWidth.description: /** Sets the column width on a single column. The finished flag gets included in the resulting event and not used internally by the grid. The finished flag is intended for dragging, where a dragging action will produce many `columnWidth` events, so the consumer of events knows when it receives the last event in a stream. The finished parameter is optional, and defaults to `true`. */

setColumnWidths.description: /** Sets the column widths on multiple columns. This method offers better performance than calling `setColumnWidth` multiple times. The finished flag gets included in the resulting event and not used internally by the grid. The finished flag is intended for dragging, where a dragging action will produce many `columnWidth` events, so the consumer of events knows when it receives the last event in a stream. The finished parameter is optional, and defaults to `true`. */

getPivotResultColumn.description: /** Returns the pivot result column for the given `pivotKeys` and `valueColId`. Useful to then call operations on the pivot column. */

removeValueColumns.description: /** Same as `removeValueColumns` but provide a list. */

addValueColumns.description: /** Same as `addValueColumn` but provide a list. */

removeRowGroupColumn.description: /** Remove a column from the row groups. */

removeRowGroupColumns.description: /** Same as `removeRowGroupColumn` but provide a list of columns. */

addRowGroupColumn.description: /** Add a column to the row groups. */

addRowGroupColumns.description: /** Same as `addRowGroupColumn` but provide a list of columns. */

removePivotColumns.description: /** Same as `removePivotColumn` but provide a list of columns. */

addPivotColumns.description: /** Same as `addPivotColumn` but provide a list of columns. */

getLeftDisplayedColumnGroups.description: /** Same as `getAllDisplayedColumnGroups` but just for the pinned left portion of the grid. */

getCenterDisplayedColumnGroups.description: /** Same as `getAllDisplayedColumnGroups` but just for the center portion of the grid. */

getRightDisplayedColumnGroups.description: /** Same as `getAllDisplayedColumnGroups` but just for the pinned right portion of the grid. */

getAllDisplayedColumnGroups.description: /** Returns all 'root' column headers. If you are not grouping columns, these return the columns. If you are grouping, these return the top level groups - you can navigate down through each one to get the other lower level headers and finally the columns at the bottom. */

autoSizeColumn.description: /** Auto-sizes a column based on its contents. */

autoSizeColumns.description: /** Same as `autoSizeColumn`, but provide a list of column keys. */

getPivotResultColumns.description: /** Returns the grid's pivot result columns. */

columnGroupOpened.description:
/** @deprecated columnGroupOpened no longer exists, use setColumnGroupOpened
 */
